*   **5xx (Server Error Status Codes)**: Generally indicate server errors, such as server downtime or request processing timeouts.

| **400** | Request body format error, etc.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              | <p>View the error content returned by the conversation or check the error content in the <a href="questions.md#kong-zhi-tai-bao-cuo-cha-kan-fang-fa">console</a> and operate according to the prompts.</p><p><a href="questions.md#kong-zhi-tai-bao-cuo-cha-kan-fang-fa"><mark style="color:purple;">**[Common Scenario 1]**</mark>: If it's a Gemini model, you might need to bind a payment method;<br><mark style="color:purple;">**[Common Scenario 2]**</mark>: Data volume exceeded, common in vision models, this error code is returned when the image volume exceeds the upstream single request traffic limit;<br><mark style="color:purple;">**[Common Scenario 3]**</mark>: Unsupported parameters were added or parameters were filled incorrectly. Try creating a clean assistant to test if it works normally;<br><mark style="color:purple;">**[Common Scenario 4]**</mark>: Context exceeded the limit, clear the context, start a new conversation, or reduce the number of context turns.</a></p> |

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| **404** | Requested resource resource not found | Check request path, etc. |
| **422** | Request format is correct, but semantic error | This type of error can be parsed by the server, but cannot be processed. It is common for JSON semantic errors (e.g., empty values; string values required, but numbers or boolean values are used). |
| **429** | Request rate limit reached | Request rate (TPM or RPM) reached the limit, wait a moment before trying again. |
| **500** | Internal server error, request cannot be completed | If it persists, contact the upstream service provider. |
| **501** | Server does not support the requested function, request cannot be completed | |
| **502** | As a gateway or proxy server, it received an invalid response from the remote server when attempting to execute the request. | |
| **503** | Due to overload or system maintenance, the server is temporarily unable to handle client requests. The length of the delay may be included in the server's Retry-After header information. | |
| **504** | The server acting as a gateway or proxy did not get the request from the remote server in time. | |

## How to Check Console Errors

*   Click on the Cherry Studio client window, then press the shortcut keys <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>I</kbd> (Mac: <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Option</kbd> + <kbd>I</kbd>)

{% hint style="info" %}
- The currently active window must be the Cherry Studio client window to bring up the console;
- You need to open the console first, then click test or initiate a conversation request to collect request information.
{% endhint %}

*   In the pop-up console window, click <mark style="color:blue;">`Network`</mark>  Click to view the last <mark style="color:red;">`completions`</mark> with a red <mark style="color:red;">``</mark> in area  _(when encountering errors in conversation, translation, model connectivity checks, etc.)_ or <mark style="color:red;">`generations`</mark> _(when encountering errors in drawing)_  Click <mark style="color:blue;">`Response`</mark> to view the complete returned content (area  in the image).

> If you cannot determine the cause of the error, please send a screenshot of this interface to the [Official Communication Group](https://t.me/CherryStudioAI) for help.

<figure><img src="../.gitbook/assets/image (1) (1) (1) (1) (1) (1) (1).png" alt="" width="563"><figcaption></figcaption></figure>

This inspection method can be used to obtain error information not only during conversations but also during model testing, adding knowledge bases, drawing, and more. In all cases, you need to open the debug window first, and then perform the request operation to obtain request information.

{% hint style="info" %}
The name in the Name column (area  in the image above) will vary in different scenarios

Conversation, Translation, Model Check: <mark style="color:red;">`completions`</mark>

Drawing: <mark style="color:red;">`generations`</mark>

Knowledge Base Creation: <mark style="color:red;">`embeddings`</mark>
{% endhint %}

## Formula Not Rendered / Formula Rendering Error

*   If the formula is not rendered but the formula code is displayed directly, check if the formula has delimiters.

> **Delimiters Usage**
>
> _Inline Formulas_
>
> *   Use a single dollar sign: `$formula$`
> *   Or use `\(` and `\)`, e.g., `\(formula\)`
>
> _Display Formulas (Block)_
>
> *   Use double dollar signs: `$$formula$$`
> *   Or use `\[formula\]`
> *   Example: `$$\sum_{i=1}^n x_i$$`\
>     $$\sum_{i=1}^n x_i$$

*   Formula rendering errors / garbled characters are common when the formula contains Chinese content; try switching the formula engine to KateX.

***

## Unable to Create Knowledge Base / Prompt: Failed to Get Embedding Dimension

1.  Model status is unavailable

> Confirm whether the service provider supports the model or if the service status of the model from the service provider is normal.

2.  Used a non-embedding model

***

## Model Cannot Recognize Images / Unable to Upload or Select Images

First, you need to confirm whether the model supports image recognition. Cherry Studio categorizes popular models; those with a small eye icon after their name support image recognition.

Image recognition models support uploading image files. If the model's capabilities are not correctly matched, you can find the model in the corresponding service provider's model list, click the settings button after its name, and check the image option.

Specific information about the model can be found by consulting its details with the corresponding service provider. Similar to embedding models, models that do not support vision do not need to have the image function forcibly enabled, and checking the image option will have no effect.
